transcript.text: Shalom everybody the 14th day of the
first Hebrew month the day of the
Passover begins tonight and so in a
little bit not quiet it's not not quite
sunset yet it will be in about an hour
or so but a little bit Jeff and I will
be doing our Passover memorial Last
Supper readings and I go through all
four Gospel accounts of the Last Supper
and for each account that we go through
we eat unleavened bread which as you can
see here has the stripes and the holes
just like Yahshua Jesus was striped and
pierced for us when he was nailed to the
tree and then we take also a cup of
juice grape juice for each of those and
then the reason I have five here I know
there's four Gospels but the fifth one
is I go to Revelation 19 where it talks
about Yahshua Jesus drinking that Cup
with us in his kingdom and he said
remember at this last supper he says
he's never gonna drink this cup again
with us until he drinks us drinks it
with us in his kingdom renewed and that
won't happen until the wedding supper of
the Lamb which is in Revelation 18 so we
go through that and when we get to the
Gospel of John which is details the foot
washing part will will actually wash
each other's feet and this will be the
the Last Supper memorial that we will be
doing
remember Yahshua said to do this in
remembrance of him
and so this is an annual observance that
I do going going into the 14th day now
going out of the 14th day which will be
tomorrow night which this year of course
is also in the the Sabbath begins that
says the 14th day goes into the feast of
unleavened bread and that's when we'll
actually do the Seder where where I have
the lamb the unleavened bread just like
right here and the bitter herbs and then
I also makes some cara set as well and
I'll show that set up as well for
tomorrow night but I just wanted to give
people just a little glimpse of what our
setup is like before we get started
later this evening all right
yeah bless you guys and may you have a
wonderful wonderful Passover Shalom
Shalom
[Music]
[Music]
